articles.headline: Jeff Flake, a Fierce Trump Critic, Will Not Seek Re-election for Senate
articles.snippet: Mr. Flake, a Republican of Arizona, said he would “no longer be complicit or silent” in the face of the president’s “reckless, outrageous and undignified” behavior.
articles.abstract: Mr. Flake, a Republican of Arizona, said he would “no longer be complicit or silent” in the face of the president’s “reckless, outrageous and undignified” behavior.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator Jeff Flake, the Arizona Republican who has tangled with President Trump for months, announced on Tuesday that he would not seek re-election in 2018, declaring on the Senate floor that he “will no longer be complicit or silent” in the face of the president’s “reckless, outrageous and undignified” behavior.

articles.headline: U.S. Must Let Undocumented Teenager Get an Abortion, Appeals Court Says
articles.snippet: The court ruled that the administration cannot block a pregnant 17-year-old from Central America, who is in federal custody in Texas, from obtaining an abortion.
articles.abstract: The court ruled that the administration cannot block a pregnant 17-year-old from Central America, who is in federal custody in Texas, from obtaining an abortion.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — She was already nine weeks into her first trimester by the time she learned she was pregnant. And by then, she was already in federal custody at the border in Texas, one of the multitude of unaccompanied minors caught trying to enter the United States without their parents or relatives. She was 17 years old.

articles.headline: Another Republican Call to Arms, but Who Will Answer?
articles.snippet: Most congressional Republicans are reluctant to upset President Trump when they are trying to piece together a tax agreement.
articles.abstract: Most congressional Republicans are reluctant to upset President Trump when they are trying to piece together a tax agreement.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A former Republican president. A senior Republican senator with a critical illness. A retiring Republican senator. And now an independent-minded Republican senator who faced a difficult, if not impossible, path to re-election.

articles.headline: China Enshrines ‘Xi Jinping Thought,’ Elevating Leader to Mao-Like Status
articles.snippet: The Communist Party has added the president’s name and ideas to its constitution, solidifying his position as China’s most powerful leader in decades.
articles.abstract: The Communist Party has added the president’s name and ideas to its constitution, solidifying his position as China’s most powerful leader in decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China’s Communist Party on Tuesday elevated President Xi Jinping to the same exalted status as the nation’s founding father, Mao Zedong, by writing his name and ideas into the party constitution.

articles.headline: Consumer Bureau Loses Fight to Allow More Class-Action Suits
articles.snippet: A Senate vote to overturn a rule restricting arbitration clauses, with Vice President Mike Pence breaking a tie, was part of a Republican push to roll back Obama-era financial regulations.
articles.abstract: A Senate vote to overturn a rule restricting arbitration clauses, with Vice President Mike Pence breaking a tie, was part of a Republican push to roll back Obama-era financial regulations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senate Republicans voted on Tuesday to strike down a sweeping new rule that would have allowed millions of Americans to band together in class-action lawsuits against financial institutions.

articles.headline: Laura Ingraham Is Ready to Rev Up Fox News
articles.snippet: Fox News is handing its 10 p.m. slot to a sharp-tongued friend of President Trump and Steve Bannon.
articles.abstract: Fox News is handing its 10 p.m. slot to a sharp-tongued friend of President Trump and Steve Bannon.
articles.lead_paragraph: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz. — Laura Ingraham landed here in a private jet and climbed into a waiting S.U.V., accompanied by her personal assistant, a publicist, and a single piece of luggage.

articles.headline: Square, the Twitter Boss’s Other Company, Could Pass It in Value
articles.snippet: Twitter may be President Trump’s favorite platform, but Square, a payments company also run by Jack Dorsey, has had more success in recent quarters.
articles.abstract: Twitter may be President Trump’s favorite platform, but Square, a payments company also run by Jack Dorsey, has had more success in recent quarters.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Jack Dorsey has become a household name in Silicon Valley thanks to his role as the chief executive and co-founder of Twitter, President Trump’s favorite megaphone.

articles.headline: Tax Cuts Are the Glue Holding a Fractured Republican Party Together
articles.snippet: The prospect of a once-in-a-generation bill to cut taxes on businesses and individuals increasingly appears to be the best hope for a party desperate for common ground.
articles.abstract: The prospect of a once-in-a-generation bill to cut taxes on businesses and individuals increasingly appears to be the best hope for a party desperate for common ground.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — One week before they are set to unveil a sprawling overhaul of the federal tax code, Republicans struggled on Wednesday with key parts of their plan, reigniting a fight over retirement savings and racing to cut a deal with lawmakers from high-tax states ahead of a critical budget vote in the House on Thursday.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Thomas Kaplan

articles.headline: David Rubenstein, Private Equity Titan, Passes the Torch
articles.snippet: The Carlyle Group’s succession planning is part of a generational change at private equity firms, as the billionaires who pioneered the industry retire.
articles.abstract: The Carlyle Group’s succession planning is part of a generational change at private equity firms, as the billionaires who pioneered the industry retire.
articles.lead_paragraph: It started with a series of meetings at the Carlyle Hotel in New York, and grew to become one of the world’s most ambitious and well-connected private equity firms. Its Rolodex was unrivaled, and its advisers included the first President George Bush and John Major, the former British prime minister.
articles.byline: By David Gelles and Michael J. de la Merced
